Articles.Content:
Anyone here Play Il-2? If you do, we should discuss this awesome game.

Also I am an insanely good pilot, I saves this, flew 100 miles wile being chased by a Zero, got my elevator controls shot away, and managed to crash land on friendly soil.

Edited August 15, 2013 by zekes
160km, for metric system guys (like me).

I don't play IL-2,but I play pacific fighter.

It's made by Stuvmorvik and,fro what I can see,it's the same principle.

In that game,I've found a funny bug that drive you to orbital speed,I can't manage to control the plane at those speed,but once the plane got to orbital altitude.

Unforunatly,pacific fighter don't provide a planetary map

BTW:in that game I have been able to return to my base from the enemy base while being chased by the enemy(I don't remember wich plane),but I was using the fastest plane of the game,and,during the chase,I didn't had to worry too much about the enemy fire.
Haven't played in a long long time now, was good fun. I have all the expansions I think ( PF was an IL2 expansion rather than an entirely new game, regardless of marketing ).

Loong time i played this game. but it was a good game.

BTW i dont thing this thread belongs to science labs. It should be moved.

by the way im not sure how to add mod packs. I cant seem to find the folder for them.

Also i thought this was the off topic? my bad....
By the way,if someone want to know how to cause the bug,I can tell him!

I am a long time IL-2 flier and this thread gives me opportunity to plug some videos that i made of IL2 in past years. I also play the new IL-2 called Cliffs of Dover which is now playable thanks to the effort of modding community.

One of my favorite games! Made this control panel, and love using it for the game.

- Apache600
is a fantastic game, havent got it installed atm, looking at getting cliffs of dover if anyone thinks its worth getting.

No, it isnt. origional game is ten times better.

Also Ive been learning to land a Spitfire on a Road, it's not easy.
Anyone know where I could obtain a copy of this and Pacific Fighter?
Look what i just did!

Beast Bomber.

EDIT:

But seriously, where can I get this?

Beast Bomber.

EDIT:

But seriously, where can I get this?

on steam...
Not the new one, the older one with Pacific Fighter as an Xpack.
vote to move to off topic.

Beast Bomber.

EDIT:

But seriously, where can I get this?

I got it on GOG....

And yeah this should be moved to off topic

vote to move to off topic.

Agreed. What does this have to do with general science?

Hello there

As has been noted, this thread belongs into the forums under control of General Off Topic (clearly an NSA spy, that's why his current identity is "The Space Lounge" for whatever reason). Operation "Move" in progress.

FEichinger

You really should just rename "The Space Lounge" back to Offtopic. It would clear up all of the ambiguity, and look better in the first place.

I'm a big fan of Sturmovik, having played all the games with moderate skill. I'm primarily a fan of the eponymous plane, but I've also had some successes with most of the planes available.

Ahh, IL-2. I have been playing this game for years now. I remember when I couldn't fly with almost any of the realistic settings, but now I am only limited by my setup and my willingness to set up a few more buttons on my keyboard. Recently, I actually got a few friends into the game, and we usually spend a good while almost daily just flying about and shooting at each other. Can't easily keep the realism and have to stick to "arcade mode," as my friends can only mainly use PS3/360 controllers, and there are issues with all the buttons needed to press.

Speaking of controllers, does anyone know how to get Saitek X-52's (non-Pro setup) working fully on Windows 7? I have been having issues, and I feel like I have overlooked something.

by the way im not sure how to add mod packs. I cant seem to find the folder for them.

You need a Mod Activator for Mods to work. For example, I use the SAS ModAct.
I used to play IL2 Sturmovik 1946 or something like that. My favourite part was bombing an aircraft carrier and then trying to land on it

I used to play IL2 Sturmovik 1946 or something like that. My favourite part was bombing an aircraft carrier and then trying to land on it

or when your being chased by someone when you have bombs onboard, just drop down low, drop your bombs and laugh as their plane gets totalled from the blast

or when your being chased by someone when you have bombs onboard, just drop down low, drop your bombs and laugh as their plane gets totalled from the blast

I did that once or twice.

Except it hit my airplane.
